oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Gliocladium catenulatum as an antagonist against grey mould on strawberry
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Lahdenperä, Marja-Leena
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Results on G. catenulatum J1446 trials; Yield increases: 5-21 % in biological control and 19-43 % in integrated control. Fruit losses caused by Botrytis decreased by 11-73 % in biological control and by 51-91 % in integrated control. G. catenulatum survives on the stamens and on other flower/fruit organs for 4-5 weeks. Affects also the self-life of the fruits.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Lahdenperä, Marja-Leena (2006) Gliocladium catenulatum as an antagonist against grey mould on strawberry. Pest, disease and weed management in strawberry - progress and challenges for the Nordic production : NJF seminar 389, Lepaa, Finland, 8-9 November 2006.
